info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero, western Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties through 445 AM MDT... At 414 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boone, or 23 miles east of Pueblo, moving northeast at 45 mph. A wind gusts to around 50 mph occurred at the Pueblo airport when this storm rolled through around 4 AM this morning. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Otero, western Crowley and northeastern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
